frame.name: Participation
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen> takes place. It can be presented either symmetrically with <fen>Participants</fen> or asymmetrically, giving <fen>Participant_1</fen> greater prominence over <fen>Participant_2</fen>. If the <fen>Event</fen> is engaged in intentionally, then there is typically a shared <fen>Purpose</fen> between the <fen>Participants</fen>. It is, however, possible that an expressed <fen>Purpose</fen> only applies to <fen>Participant_1</fen>.
<ex>MATAC looks forward to <fex name="par1">your</fex> <t>participation</t> <fex name="eve">in helping promote telework in the Mid-Atlantic region</fex>.</ex>
<ex> FOAP provides <t>participants</t> with comprehensive clerical skills. <fex name="eve">DNI</fex></ex> <ex> FOAP provides <fex name="par">participants</fex> with comprehensive clerical skills. </ex>
<ex><fex name="par1">Our eight-year-old son</fex> <m>was</m> <fex name="tim">recently</fex> <fex name="deg">peripherally</fex> <t>involved</t> <fex name="eve">in an incident which resulted in him being threatened with the strap</fex>.</ex>
<ex>A New York press agent must scramble when <fex name="par1">his major client</fex> <m>becomes</m> <t>embroiled</t> <fex name="eve">in a huge scandal</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Time">In his time as a first-team all-league player</fex>, <fex name="Participant_1">Rife</fex> <m>was</m> <t>in</t> <fex name="Event">on 86 solo tackles</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Participants
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individuals or entities that have been participants in an <fen>Event</fen>.
<ex>Thereafter, <fex name="par">everybody</fex> <t>participated</t> in the 17 May parade ending in the Nordic Club.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Participant_1
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Participant_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
<ex>Last year, <fex name="par1">Bill</fex> <t>participated</t> in the Montana State University Earth Systems Science distance learning course in the Atmosphere Unit.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Participant_2
FE.definition:
<def-root>A grammatically less prominent participant of an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
<ex>The Second Amended Complaint alleges that Andrew S. Pitt ("Pitt"), Conectisys Corporation ("Conectisys" or the "Company"), and BM Capital Corp. <t>participated</t> <fex name="par2">with Zaman and Smith Benton</fex> in a fraudulent and manipulative trading scheme.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>, who may or may not be involved intentionally.
<ex>Some who <t>participated</t> <fex name="eve">in D-Day</fex> are finally ready to talk about it</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the multiple-participant <fen>Event</fen> occurs.
<ex>A survey of students who <t>participated</t> <fex name="tim">last year</fex> showed that 61 percent would be the first in their family to attend college.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Event</fen> involving multiple <fen>Participants</fen> occurs.
<ex>The most exciting tours for Mr. Osako were when he <t>participated</t> <fex name="pla">in France, Belgium, Holland, Cuba and Japan</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the Event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). When the <fen>Participants</fen> are understood agentively frames, it may indicate salient characteristics of them that also affect the action (deliberately, eagerly).
<ex>He had performed well on the varsity wrestling team and <t>participated</t> <fex name="man">eagerly</fex> in student government</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Participants</fen> or <t>Participant_1</t> intend to accomplish by performing the action indicated by the <fen>Event</fen>.
<ex>Mahoney <t>participated</t> <fex name="pur">in order to protest racism in the United States in general</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An intentional action performed by <fen>Participant_1</fen> or the <fen>Participants</fen> that contributes to bringing off the <fen>Event</fen>.
<ex>WICS-TV <t>participated</t> <fex name="mea">by handing out pamphlets, corporate job opening lists and other information regarding employment opportunities within the broadcasting field</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree_of_involvement
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which <fen>Participant_1</fen> contributes to the <fen>Event</fen>'s coming off.
<ex>We built a new hospital here in 1991, but I was on the board then and only <fex name="deg">peripherally</fex> <t>involved</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Institution
FE.definition:
<def-root>A group, location, or institution conventionally associated with an <fen>Event</fen>.
<ex>Several of the countries were unable to <t>participate</t> <fex name="ins">in the market</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the length of time for which participation occurs (usually appears as a for-PP)</def-root>

lexUnit.name: participant.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: somebody who participates in an event

lexUnit.name: participation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of participating in a process or the state of participating in a relationship

lexUnit.name: involved.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: engaged as a (willing or unwilling) participant

lexUnit.name: involvement.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of participating in an event with multiple participants

lexUnit.name: embroiled.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: deeply involved in a conflict or difficult situation.

lexUnit.name: player.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person that is involved and influential in an activity.

lexUnit.name: entangled.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: participating involuntarily, without the ability to stop participating at once

lexUnit.name: entanglement.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: involuntary involvement in a complex affair such that rapid extrication is impossible.

lexUnit.name: take part.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: join in or be involved in an activity.

lexUnit.name: party.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a participant in an event.
